item.title: A Birthday Card For Swami
item.description: In this card have written a lovely message which given by our beloved Swami, Birthday wishes, Swami’s picture and were added decorations like flowers. Birthday Card Gallery References https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nq9pbsVecFs

item.title: Baba, My Love
item.description: Happy birthday to my dearest Baba, the ultimate Love of my Life. Here is a simple gift box made especially for YOU. My wish on Your birthday is for everyone in this world to have sparkling and glittering hearts filled with Love, helping and uplifting one another. Samastha Lokah Sukhino Bavanthu. I will make You proud. Thank you for everything…You are the BEST! Love Always… Your Child, Shivendraa Gallery

item.title: Love
item.description: Start the day with love; Fill the day with love; Spend the day with love; End the day with love; This is the way to God. div.quote { font-style: italic; text-align:center; margin-top: auto; margin-bottom: auto; margin-left: 2em; margin-right: 2em; } Swami’s life is His message and His message is love. Love is the basis of human life. If we see the world with love, it would be filled with positivity.

item.title: Signs & Wonders Of Sathya Sai
item.description: Bhagwan Himself narrates a glimpse of amazing miracles towards mankind which is beyond one’s explanations. To comprehend Baba’s significant signs of wonders, we must delve faithfully to understand His glory and experience the element of divinity. The approach of love and affection that He showers upon all, is purely divine and magical. In a discourse on December 1976, He said that His manifestations were not to deceive and mislead the people but to attract, reconstruct, transform, and make them useful and serviceable for society.

item.title: The Divine Lullaby
item.description: The story of Queen Madālasā is in Chapters 25-30 of the Mārkaṇḍeya Purāṇa. The Mārkaṇḍeya is one of the eighteen ‘great Purāṇas’ (Mahāpurāṇas) relating to Brahmā, said to have been narrated by the Riṛṣi Mārkaṇḍeya. In this mythological tale, Queen Madālasā’s newborn child was named by the King. Upon hearing the name given by the King, the baby started to cry out loud. Madālasā sings this beautiful lullaby to pacify the child.
